analytic.title: A Fifteenth-Century Spiritual Anthology from the Monastery of Mar Ḥannanyā

biblStruct.note: The present article gives a description of MS Charfeh 212 (olim 38), a West Syrian monastic anthology (1466), intended for novices of the Monastery of Mār Ḥannanyā or Deir al-Za‘farān in south-eastern Turkey. The introduction contains the translation of a fragment dealing with the foundation of this monastery. The greater part of this article is devoted to the identification of the different treatises selected by the compilers of this anthology.
